summary: The 'Saving Natural Ecosystems and Marine Organisms Act of 2025' (Saving NEMO Act of 2025) aims to protect certain marine reef species. It prohibits specific actions, like taking, importing, and exporting designated 'covered coral reef species'. The Secretary of the Interior, in consultation with the Secretary of Commerce, will designate these species, primarily those listed in Appendix II of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species (CITES). The bill includes exceptions for scientific, museum, or breeding purposes, and establishes enforcement mechanisms with civil and criminal penalties, citizen action provisions, and definitions.
